required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Intruding Angle on Non-graft Osteotome Sinus Elevation
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Implant Intruding Angle on Osteotome Sinus Elevation Without Grafting

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital of Stomatology, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: Hospital of Stomatology, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: The contour of maxillary sinus matters in osteotome sinus elevation. So does the implant intruding angle between the axis of the implant and the tangent line of the sinus floor contour. The investigators have been engaged in studying the relationship between the outcome of bone formation and the intruding angle, which could guide our clinical decision-making.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from the time of performing the implanting surgery to the latest recalling period, accessed up to 100 months
primary_outcome.description: endosinus bone change after osteotome sinus elevation without grafting

arm_group.description: the group whose level of sinus floor is lower than both of the adjacent teeth
the group whose level of sinus floor is lower than one of the adjacent teeth and higher than the other one of the adjacent teeth
the group whose level of sinus floor is similar to both of the adjacent teeth

study_pop.textblock: Patients who visited Guanghua Hospital of Stomatology, Sun Yat-Sen University from July 2006 to August 2018.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with residual bone height >4mm and osteotome sinus elevation together with simultaneous implant placement without grafting
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smokers or patients with systemic disease.

facility.name: Hospital of Stomatology, Sun Yat-sen University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Hospital of Stomatology, Sun Yat-Sen University
responsible_party.investigator_title: Director, Head of Implantology, Principal Investigator, Clinical Professor
